item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 19, 2024 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Have you ever seen soldering this close? [video] (194 points | 30 comments)
2. Is Tor still safe to use? (389 points | 286 comments)
3. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1352 points | 401 comments)

6. Ruby-SAML pwned by XML signature wrapping attacks (58 points | 32 comments)

8. Debugging Behind the Iron Curtain (2010) (24 points | 1 comment)
9. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (171 points | 17 comments)
10. AI agents invade observability: snake oil or the future of SRE? (27 points | 30 comments)
11. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (211 points | 108 comments)

13. Interning in Go (63 points | 14 comments)
14. Are You Qualified to Use Null in SQL? (9 points | 3 comments)

21. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (74 points | discuss)
22. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (60 points | 16 comments)
23. A Message from Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger to Employees (14 points | 15 comments)

25. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1481 points | 758 comments)
26. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (270 points | 107 comments)
27. The Dune Shell (179 points | 56 comments)
28. iOS 18 breaks IMAPS self-signed certs (42 points | 70 comments)
29. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (39 points | 25 comments)
30. Text makeup – a tool to decode and explore Unicode strings (35 points | 3 comments)
